result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua F Corson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Courts states that at the most, this is to be paid during the term of probation. (2015CT68).
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

9:15 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Josh Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - defendant will plea to DC with a fine and costs and the other 2 counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Zamzow concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 3 as charged and orders counts 1 & 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$250 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Courts states that at the most, this is to be paid during the term of probation. (2015CT68).
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:21 a.m.
Status hearing on April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

10:52 a.m  Defendant present in court with Atty Joshua Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Zamzow - regarding case.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 18, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:53 a.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 9, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:54 a.m.
